reviews.text: For over 50 years I have had the pleasure of visiting the magnificent Biltmore house and gardens. Every visit leaves me in awe at so many levels. The art treasures, craftsmanship, landscaping and family history are so impressive to me. This year for the first time I took the Candlelight Christmas tour. It was an enchanted evening for all of my family. Be sure to pay a little extra and rent the easy to use audio tour.

The house was amazing. They were doing a great deal of cleaning when we went.  Employees were very nice and happy to answer any questions we had.  The only reason I did not give them 5 stars was in order to get to a restroom you had to go to the first  level and leave the actual house.  Then go to a separate area.  It was a fairly good walk to get to a rest room.

Super cool place.  We were there when they had a super cool blown glass exhibit in the gardens. I grew up in Belgium and have traveled all over Europe, I've seen cool formal gardens all over the world. And these can compete! It was extra fun to hang out in the succulent room. And the best part, if you stay outside and keep them leashed, totally dog friendly!

Amazing residence and interesting story of the people and lives lived at Biltmore.  Get the audio tour, enhances the walk around.  Formal gardens are amazing, particularly the greenhouse.  If you like the Victorian era this tour is perfect.  The wine room is okay, wait times can be discouraging and the rises to the level of okay to not bad.

Fun time walking around the property grounds, gardens and house. Amazing property and even more grand interior of the house. The tour takes you through many parts of the house to see the history and many old artifacts from around the world. Lots of walking so bring comfortable shoes.

You are ruining this beautiful town you meaning city council and specially mayor you keep building houses and motels call the call the traffic is terrible ifif you you're going keep building then fix our our infrastruc I demand you to stop the building you've ruined my city why would anyone do this maybe a little money in the pocket I I think anybody that Ron's 4 office should be a native
She responded well
Beautiful historical building. It should remain preserved & maintained as is! Most unique building in Asheville!
A weirdo building in Asheville. Not much to say about it other than the shape.
Really cool old building.  I love it that they still have an elevator operator.  He also doubles as a piano player in the lobby and is very good.
Lots of good vibes here, coffee downstairs sky bar upstairs
Nice View of the city.

A great resort experience on Sunset Mountain. The view from the resort is phenomenal and best at sunset. The amenities are fantastic and the restaurants are top notch. Unfortunately, the rooms do not live up to the fit and finish of the common areas of the hotel. They are quite outdated and a bit uncomfortable for the high price. When you stay at this property, you are paying for the common areas, not the rooms.

This hotel is wonderful and unique. In a word it's magical. The staff are helpful and friendly and views inside and outside are amazing. It's stepping back in time the best way possible. You truly feel like you're on vacation at this resort. They make every attempt to create a peaceful environment.

Fantastic hotel. The spa is top notch. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Stayed in a Club floor room and would recommend this to anyone (daily breakfast, nightly happy hour, and spa access included), well worth the extra $$. Had dinner at Vue 1913. It is expensive but amazing, well worth the occasional splurge. Loved every minute being here.

Amazing resort with some great views of the mountains and downtown Asheville in the distance. There are a number of shops to visit, tasty restaurants to eat at and great outdoor seating! There are a number of bars and even an amazing spa! The staff is very friendly and helping. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable. I look forward to coming back again!

Absolutely stunning view from this porch. We just be for some drinks and the view and it was worth the trip. I wish we could have stayed until sunset but it was a hot day and we had more to see! I have to say the bartenders were especially excellent- I asked for something virgin and delicious and they did not disappoint!! I had a few of the peach, ginger mojitos! The peach drink on the menu was our groups favorite so if I come back I'll definitely be trying that.

The Asheville Masonic Temple was the perfect venue for our wedding. The historic theater served as the unique space that we were looking for right in the heart of downtown Asheville and being able to keep our reception on the same floor was a huge plus. Taylor and the entire events team went out of their way to make sure our day was flawless from day one of the planning process to the day of.

One of the loveliest historic buildings in Asheville. Perfect acoustics for concerts and weddings, alike. The decor is unlike any other, so, so beautiful. Highly recommend for weddings, gatherings and concerts.

I pretty much forced my boyfriend into doing this with me and guess what?  Amazing experience! He loved every minute and so did I. Tad was incredibly knowledgeable of Asheville’s history and past. He also put a bit of comedy into an otherwise eerie subject. We have never enjoyed a tour that much. At the end we got to share some one on one time with Tad and got to know a little more about his POV on the whole subject. 20/10 recommend!

This is a gorgeous space with lots of room for gatherings. We practiced yoga here and enjoyed ourselves immensely. The building is beautiful and old, and well-preserved. Having a wedding here would be awesome! The rooms seem very spacious and the building was easy to access.

We had our wedding ceremony in the gorgeous theater at the Asheville Masonic Temple. Taylor, Shay, and their event team were so easy to work with and helped make the day run seamlessly. I'd highly recommend this venue for anyone looking for a downtown Asheville event space.
Really impressive historical monument to a key leader in NC history.  Great architectural structure.

Ok I want to get one thing straight, Vance is not racist. Anyways this place is a good place to read and if you want some sweets, the French Broad Chocolate Lounge is pretty close by.
Very peaceful.

It’s truly baffling this monument is considered kind of the center of town, considering its subject matter. I mean, this is Asheville, how is it not constantly covered in protest graffiti? Especially the kind of crowd that hangs near it, where I either saw people openly doing drugs, performing impromptu songs, usually with the worst singing imaginable. The stores nearby are good. This monument? Very bad.

It's a pretty nice spot in downtown Asheville. Especially when it's decorated. 
#downtownAVL
It's 2019... Why are there still memorials to the Confederacy?

It's totally worth going into & experiencing the beautiful interior. There is a sweet smell of insects a feeling of awe and peacefulness that comes over you. I'm not sure if you enter it or if it enters you. Love.

Beautiful. Historic. Truly an architectural marvel. Not large, but the design details and craftsmanship are astounding. A revered place in Western North Carolina.  Please visit, and please donate to the restoration fund - there is water damage occuring, if I remember correctly it will be a million dollar job to repair.
I have been more than once. They offer tours and welcome anyone to admire the beautiful Church. It's truly a must see place!
Very beautiful place and a gentleman that was there was given us the background history.  It was very interesting.
If only I was a saint.  Since Lawrence is my name I could live there. What a beautiful building.

...beautiful sermon and music rooted in the traditions of great theologians and composers while also respecting the thoughtful that is new.
...gently-friendly congregation, too : )
A surprisingly non-judgmental church that does a lot of loving Mission work. Solid, scripture based teaching and the music is fantastic. Friendly folks, too.
Great place for meetings
Went to a DAR meeting.
Got kicked out
A beautiful church in downtown Asheville. The wood work in the chapel with the renovation of the stained glass is beautiful to look at. A historic.building.
Peace of mind
Good service
Enlightening
The Coon rates this 5/5. Parking lot was really close to breweries. I recommend the handicap spot (minus Sunday 7am-1pm)

Cool museum, it's just a lot smaller than I expected and only hosts rotating exhibits. Don't expect to spend more than 30 minutes here. It's good to pop in if you are in the neighborhood, but not worth a trip to see just the museum. On the positive side, is free to visit.

In its latest version this is a teeny-tiny space that always has a lovely small exhibit of some folk artist or craft type.  I think the larger version lost its funding.  It expands and contracts over the years but I have seen
wonderful artists there that I would never otherwise have been exposed to.  Nice little gift shop also
This place was awesome!! These magnificent carousel animals brought back lovely memories from my childhood!  A must - see!!!

My friend suggested this place to me during a conversation in which we talked about artist blocks, namely the expectations that artists put on themselves when trying to create a work of art. (Seriously, why do we do this? It feels so paralyzing sometimes.)

And what better place to get back that inspiration than a (free!) museum that celebrates folk artists—people who often had no formal training but who still managed to create pieces that resonated with others and that sometimes spoke about larger societal issues?

This museum is small, I’ll grant you that. However, they use what little space they have well. There are revolving exhibits; my friend and I were there to see John Dunkley’s “Neither Day nor Night” and Paa Joe’s “Gates of No Return.” I agree with previous reviewers that I wouldn’t make this place the main focus of a day trip. It’s a bit too small for that. However, if you pair it with lunch or dinner at nearby eateries, it makes for a nice, relaxing trip. If you’re an artist or art appreciator, I’m sure you will find a few things within the exhibits to make it worthwhile. =)

What really enchanted me were the cabinets near the entrance, where you could temporarily store your belongings or coat. The images of art on each cabinet correspond to an image attached to a key so that when you return, there is no confusion as to where you stored your stuff. I loved this small touch; if only they printed the name of the artist and piece on the back of each card!
See amazing hand work exhibits and free Wednesday afternoon Swing-Jazz with Bill Wurtzel-guitar!

Beautiful art work and very helpful staff. The art was so unique, medium I had not seen before. I didn't realize at first that the vases were made from wood. Phenomenal pieces. And the Raku panels were so lovely and interesting. Loved spending time in this gallery.

Nice small gallery in downtown Asheville that has pieces from local artists in Western North Carolina. The owners are artists as well and sell their own pieces as well as other area artists. Good location and in the heart of the downtown area. Since nice pieces and interesting stop
Beautiful hand made jewelry!
What an incredible gallery of local artists.  An awesome link to the artists themselves and their work.
Really sweet small gallery with a variety of styles of art for sale.
Good stuff,  nice people,  good art

I really enjoyed being able to talk to one of their local artists on each of my visits. They have about 30 different artist exhibiting in a variety of subjects and art forms.   Great, Affordable prices, too. Viewing space is large and open. Contemporary and traditional artists all in one place. A Must see on your trip to downtown Asheville, NC.
Nice gallery with many local artist,  the clerk on duty is actually one of the artist, very helpful and knowledgeable.  Very reasonable prices!
An uninteresting space with very average artworks.

I have watched this gallery grow from a train-that-could start-up in the River Arts District to a grown-up elegant gallery, located in a prime spot in Biltmore Village. They have a great and evolving mix of oil painters. Their glass art is getting better every year and their ceramic artists are climbing in quality. The owners are casual and young but do not let that stop you from checking out this rising star. I would recommend that anyone interested in the Asheville art scene checkout: Bella Vista.

My Favorite Gallery in Asheville, bar none.  Christin, the gallery owner, surprised me. At first I thought she was just a sales-girl; I just started talking with her and found her very helpful, and she was a good listener. 

The Mix is very eclectic. There were several great glass artists that caught my eye, and they had a very nice collection of my favorite: Raku. 

I ended up getting two beautiful paintings,.which she shipped to my house for me.

This will be my first stop next time I am in Asheville!

Passing through Asheville, on my way from the St. Patricks Parade in New Orleans to New York on Monday for business. I spotted this Gallery from the Hotel, Across the Street, where I am staying.

I must say if this gallery represents the type of Art here in Asheville then there is a lot more going on here than I realized. I may have to come back and visit Asheville again.

Very eclectic mix, words never describe Art well. There was a realist Pastel artist that blew my mind. They have some very contemporary artists as well as some truly luxurious traditional painters.

I picked up a beautiful Porcelain Raku piece (I didn't even know they did Porcelain Raku) had it shipped to my wife for our home in Norman.

Well worth the visit.

This was an interesting little museum dedicated to the history of a very famous arts college that operated in North Carolina in the mid 20th century. You would think that for such a famous institution, which saw so many famous artists, the foundation would be able to afford some nicer digs and a bigger space. The actual place is just a single storefront, ground floor and basement. The main exhibition area is on the ground floor, and they seem to focus on different members of the college's faculty at different times. Check to see who is being displayed, because when we went, they only had work up by a single painter and almost nothing by anyone else. The basement has a library and discussion/classroom area, gift shop, and a tiny bit more exhibition space.

Very engaging exhibitions at this small museum. Exhibitions focus on art produced by artists who taught or studied at the legendary, avant-garde Black Mountain College, which brought Bauhaus theories of art and craft to the US (Josef and Anni Albers and some of the other instuctors were major European artists who had fled Nazi Germany).  I have visited twice and both times, the exhibitions featured wonderful art plus fascinating archival photos and other materials. Most recently, I saw the excellent Jacob Lawrence exhibition, which included new artworks responding to Lawrence's art made by four contemporary artists. I highly recommend visiting!
Saw. A one man play on Buckmaster Fuller. It was great.
Great arts space!

This museum consists of two storefronts across the street from each other. They are more like art galleries than a museum, there is nothing about the history of Black Mountain College.  On the day I went, one of the rooms was open and had works by an artist historically associated with the college.  On the other there was a sign "back  in five minutes" Some people had already waited ten minutes, I waited five more. The woman across the street, in the other storefront, said "maybe he went to lunch".   I called their phone number and got the answering service, no call back.  If you visiting Asheville and happen to be in the neighborhood, stop in and see what is on display. But don't go out of your way to go there.

I asked for a quote on some work I wanted done and they estimated literally twice the price that I'd heard from another jeweler the same day. This seems to be at least partially a location based price hike just because they can. Of course overhead is probably super high on Haywood St, so there's that. Other than that, staff were friendly and seemed knowledgeable. Selection was relatively large, which is a plus if you're looking to just buy something there.

I had an awesome experience getting my wedding band here. Tori was incredibly helpful throughout the process and a pleasure to work with! I (hopefully) won't be needing another wedding band but if I do I'd be sure to come here.
Always beautiful and original work! I always stop by when I'm in Asheville.
Amazing jewelry. They really do look like they are dancing! Prices are a little steep but on par for Asheville.

My husband and I discovered Paula Dawkins of Jewels that Dance on a recent visit to Asheville. And we were so lucky we walked through her door. Paula designed the perfect ring with my stones. She was able to take my idea and put it together with her design expertise and it is a stunning ring. Just perfect. All the staff was very nice, knowledgeable and accommodating. 
Thank you so much Paula!

Kim have helped me decorate two of my houses over the years with K2 furniture and my husband have also bought furniture from K2 in the past before we got married. The quality and style are amazing. K2 provides excellent service. My 4 years old daughter love the store. My house is 100% furniture and decorated but I still stop by the store if I am in downtown to check what is new and to say hello to Kim and her wonderful staff. By the way, the first house that Kim decorated for me was sold and the buyer request the house with the furniture. Roberta

Kim and her staff are design professionals! With their expert guidance, I was able to purchase a beautiful and sturdy sectional couch custom-made for my living room. The process of selecting furniture style, construction, fabric and dimensions is a challenging one for normal mortals.  The folks at K2 Studio made the experience pleasant and satisfying.

My wife and I love K2 Furniture. We have worked with Kim for the last five months selecting furniture for our home. Kim has been extremely helpful with design tips and helping us picture what our space should look like based on our decorating goals. Recently Kim was in the area working with another customer and stopped by our house to look at our space first hand. Seeing our home allowed Kim to help us visualize what furniture would fit well into our space. Kim has also been a great resource  researching everything from a desk and bookshelf for my wife's office space to kitchen chairs and barstools. I highly recommend Kim and K2 furniture for your interior decorating needs...it's a great store.
Beautiful store. The owner absolutely knows her stuff! She did all the spacial planning for our new home. Highly recommend this place.
Like their look. A little pricey for me
Really sweet small gallery with a variety of styles of art for sale.
Good stuff,  nice people,  good art

I really enjoyed being able to talk to one of their local artists on each of my visits. They have about 30 different artist exhibiting in a variety of subjects and art forms.   Great, Affordable prices, too. Viewing space is large and open. Contemporary and traditional artists all in one place. A Must see on your trip to downtown Asheville, NC.
Nice gallery with many local artist,  the clerk on duty is actually one of the artist, very helpful and knowledgeable.  Very reasonable prices!
An uninteresting space with very average artworks.

Wow!  Great people great gifts.  I bought a pair of earrings 3-4 years ago that I loved and always received compliments on.  Then I lost one 🙄.  A couple months ago when cleaning out a draw I found the box they came in with the store name.  I reached out and they recreated the pair.  I have my favorites back with a spare!! The compliments on them are rolling in.  So glad they are here.  Will visit the store again when in Ashville!
Cool place to visit. Coming back when I get my new home.
Always love that store.  Of course, I bought some things.
Place has local arts, you can see live action. you can see artists painting, some of the arts very unique and special. but they are very expensive
Lots of interesting stuff. My daughter was fascinated. But it shows its age.
Great gallery downtown. Beautiful space. And Bill is a super great guy. Always a supporter of the local artists but also a great collection of art from around the country. Check it out if you can.
Some some great work here and had a lovely conversation with the gallery owner's assistant who not only talked about the displayed work but guided me to other galleries in the area.
Adventurous art and courteous dealer
Art

Love going to this variety store when in Asheville....you definitely don't want to miss it! Nice little diner inside as well. Birthday or Christmas shopping? You've come to the right place. The art here is just one of the amazing pieces you'll see.... all mediums represented.

Interesting mid century modern drug store converted to a gallery. Food counter has soda fountain fare. Art in the gallery is a little pedestrian,  but it's a cool venue.  Other shops and restaurants nearby make this a nice destination.

Love this place! Super neat experience to walk through and see the vast majority of artisans and their work is locally produced. By far the best collection of unique and well-done craftsmanship I have seen in one venue. Time is easily and enjoyably spent while walking through!

I love how local artists are featured here. It's fun to look around and see the many pieces that are showcased. The cafe inside has tasty food and quick service. Great for a quick lunch after walking through the galleries. It's not really the kind of place you'd expect great service since you just order at the deli bar and there isn't table service. There aren't really people to walk you through the galleries, but again it's more of a self guided venue which is the fun part.

What a great way to repurpose a large retail space.  Dozens of local artists offer a wide variety of works and price ranges.  You need to set time aside if you are really going to experience what is on exhibit.  Hungry?  They have an old time food counter, kind of a fun and neat experience 👍

I attended a lecture about Zelda Fitzgerald. It was wonderful! It lasted close to an hour and I easily could have listened to more. The presenter was well-prepared and knew his subject matter. He had a slide presentation that was good. There was a lively question and answer session after the talk. I will look forward to attending another event.

A little disappointing.. entrance was free, there were 2-3 pieces of art worth seeing but very small exhibit. This is temporary until their main building is finished. (Half of this just had info about the construction of the new place)

Don't do it!!!  For a town famous for its artists, this museum was a tremendous disappointment.  'Ho-hum' describes its best moments well.  I think they need to rethink their curation to reflect the local artist community making it more relevant to the area, and  therefore unique, instead of offering one more stuffy gallery of art that you can see in anytown USA.
Very small, not much of anything right now but the new location to come I'm sure will be amazing!
Beautiful people and place. If you enjoy art you should visit this place

February 24, 2018- I and mom was first time there. Welcome to Smith-McDowell house museum. I love see around house about old history ago 1800's. So beautiful of Victorian house. That's two peoples and lady tour walk around house and not bad pay $9.00 adults. 💞
Nice glimpse back in time. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable. The older I get the more I enjoy places like this.
Cool place.  The ladies there were extremely knowledgeable and friendly.
The staff is so very friendly and helpful. I took my 11 year old for a tour and he enjoyed it. I loved the sunroom the best! Great place to visit!

February 24, 2018- i and mom was first time there. Welcome to Smith-McDowell house museum. I love see around house🏡 about old history ago 1800's. So beautiful of Victorian house. That's two peoples and lady tour walk around house and not bad pay $9.00 adults.

there was a wait, but well worth it. the food tasted amazing and fresh. each bite full with flavor. also I doubt you'll be hungry after they serve you a huge bowl of goodness. extremely affordable!!! not pricey at all

Such great service and amazing food! I've had a few dishes here and they're all very tasty.  Very flavorful, colorful and the combination of different veggies and protein is done exceptionally well!  I will definitely be back for more!  Also, very good for vegetarians!

What impressed me the most is that Doc Chey's pays attention to the taste and quality of their meat (pork, beef, chicken)as well as providing delicious rice, noodles and sauces. The quality, service, servers and price were outstanding. I consider the meal a value for what we received. I've posted specifics on Yelp regarding dishes and appetizers that we have. Brooke was an excellent and conscientious server although everyone that works helped with service and clearing.

The service is always good and the food is a little better than average. As with any chain, there's not a lot of experimentation going on with the food. It's standard fare at a reasonable price. They offer a decent Gluten Free selection. This place has it's fans and will please a wide range of eaters.

Twenty minute wait on a Friday night wasn't bad, with lots of cute shops to duck into nearby. Very friendly and helpful waitress, though she was a bit rushed. The green beans (heavy on soy but delicious) and pork dumplings made excellent starters. One noodle entree with pork and one rice entree with chicken was adequate food for three women. Hot berry/ginger tea was delicious and a perfect compliment. Place was busy, but somehow noise levels did not interfere with conversation.

Wonderful service and atmosphere. The architecture of the building alone is worth checking out.
I went at lunch on the weekend which was still buffet style. It was delicious. I've eaten at a lot of Indian restaurants as it's my wife's favorite food and this one rated among the middle top for me.

Delicious lunch buffet!  I counted about 6 main dishes in addition to rices, various chutneys, salads and desserts.  Excellent labeling of all the dishes, I eat vegan and gluten free and appreciated that every single item was clearly marked.  A more upscale atmosphere than most Indian restaurants with kind of a warehouse/loft feel to the setting.  The paid parking lot across the street was small & full, but we were able to find on-street parking fairly close.  Will definitely return!

Quick business trip to Asheville and wanted some Indian food. What a great choice! Lunch buffet well stocked with a nice variety of traditional cuisine. Absolutely delicious food 😋 Staff very friendly and attentive. Ambiance perfect. Will be back 👍

Delicious food! Lunch buffet was a great way to try different options and less than $13! Everything was fresh and there were so many choices! It's about the length of one short wall but and there arent many meat options but there's a great variety. Kylie was my server and she was great! Very sweet, attentive and gave great suggestions!

Fine Indian food, downtown. They've never disappointed. The lunch buffet is excellent, and the a la carte dinner menu is even better. Veggie friendly, but carnivores will be delighted too. Warning, the vindaloo is hot, hot, hot (and delicious!). I'm also a big fan of their korma, samosas, and seafood.

I really enjoyed this restaurant in downtown.  The service was very good and the vibe was very nice.  I ordered the squash fritters and beet salad and it was pretty good,  just didn't like the slate plates.  Roomy, fairly quiet,  large alcohol section too. I would definitely return.

Excellent, Excellent, Excellent! The atmosphere was wonderful, the music was great, the hospitality was awesome along with the excellent service. The food presentation was spectacular and the food was extremely deliciously. You will definitely want to return to The Market Place.
Stevie Parker,
Train Em Up Youth Enrichment Program.
Great atmosphere and friendly, helpful staff. The brunch menu is superb, especially the scallops! The service and the food were so great!

Brunch was delicious! Reservations are recommended. We were able to sit at the bar without one. Had the Eggs Benton and highly recommend it as a delicious breadless option. The roasted potatoes on my husband's dish were wonderful!

This was a party that we threw at the market place restaurant in Asheville North Carolina for my wife. Everything went perfect. The staff was great, food was great, atmosphere was great. We did the brunch that worked out fantastic! Thank you guys so much.

This was one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. I was here in November of 2018 and sat at the bar with Stephanie bartending. I was asking questions about the menu because it was so unique and unlike anything I had seen before. She mentioned that the chef was raised in Mexico, but received his technical training in France which made so much sense when looking at the menu. We ordered the nachos (twice), the bouillabaisse, and the bread pudding. It was all fantastic and I want to go back to Asheville just to revisit this place.

Excellent Latin mezcla of the best variety. I love that they take the flavors of Latin cuisine and blend it with ingredients that are not traditional Latin fare. The dessert is incredible, if you have a big table order them all and share!

We ate here last night and it was excellent. Our friends who used to live in Asheville took us here because it’s one of their favorites. Now I know why. Service was great. Everything we ate was top notch. I had the filet and lobster mac and cheese. The lobster pieces in the mac and cheese were huge! I would definitely eat here again!  Inventive and delicious food. You won’t go wrong with anything ordered. Kudos to chef for traditional Mexican and fusion dishes that delight the palate. Very kind and attentive staff to top it off!

Stopped in while visiting from Florida and was very impressed. Our waiter who I believe was named Phil, was very interactive and even gave us tips about the city. He was spot on about everything he recommended. The salmon and steak were fantastic as was the ceviche. Definitely would recommend.
Insane good.  Trust me get the scallops. Margaritas are unique and interesting but so so delicious

The pineapple salsa was good, and I always love fried plantains... but everything else was okay at best. The mole lacked depth. The chips are like the cheap, hard kind you get at a grocery store. They’re definitely not made in house. Also $14 for 3 salsas and some chips is outrageous. I’d pass on it, if you’re looking for something spectacular.

Not your typical Mexican place! From the daily salsa list (try the strawberry salsa if you see it!) to lots of beautiful and flavorful specials, you'll find something to please your palate. If you have any questions about the dishes, the staff is quite willing to explain the menu and help you find the perfect plate. Oh, and the margaritas are top notch! It's a small place so we've found it best to go just after lunch. Note: They close at 4pm and reopen at 5pm.
Food is wonderful and well priced. The restaurant is quite small and gets full quickly, but  it is worth the wait. Service is rapid and overall, the restaurant is a great experience.

This place is amazing, they serve real delicious Mexican/Caribbean food. The waitresses and the cooks were on it, they were super nice and friendly. The wait was just a few mins. We enjoyed the food and will definitely recommend to anybody.

There was a little bit of a wait for 15 people but they did the best to accommodate us tonight. One of the best Mexican restaurants we have had and definitely worth the wait!! Thank you for the excellent service and food!!!

The food was top notch. The cocktails were delicious. The atmosphere was on point. Front of house was great and the bartenders were attentive and helpful.

 Our server on the other hand was one of the worst I've ever encountered. He never greeted the table or described the menu/specials, it took us nearly twenty minutes to order, he didn't ask to refresh drinks when all of our party had finished them, and was just generally unpleasant. Did the tattoos and beards scare him off or make him think we wouldn't tip well?

Highly recommend this restaurant as long as you don't have the same server as we did. From the table full of all former service industry guys, the 20%+ tip and this review are dedicated to the server who ignored the 9:00 reservation on Sat Mar 9 at table 8/2. Cheers.

Great atmosphere. The menu is definitely tough (particularly wine) to decipher but our server was very knowledgeable. The food was amazing. I had some of the most amazing and fresh mussels I’ve ever had and the pasta was incredible. They were able to accommodate a party of 10 (we made a reservation). Look forward to going back!

We spent Christmas Eve at Cucina24 and enjoyed their special Feast of the Seven Fishes. Our server was a dream, the environment was lovely, and the food was outstanding. Will definitely return the next time I'm in town!
Beautiful facility. Nice wait person. But: Very salty food. Undercooked pasta. 1 hour wait from ordering to serving entree in a half-empty restaurant.
This place is an absolute gem! The service is perfect, the food is amazing. The tasting menu is out of this world.

Absolutely the best. Delicious food. Super friendly and helpful staff. The MOST accommodating to families with young children. Very popular and may be a wait. Totally worth it. They have a text paging system so check in and walk around for a little bit until your table is ready. Fantastic. Five stars all around!!!

Food was good, bacon was so amazing, the biscuits and gravy would have been amazing if they had been warm. The waitstaff made us feel as if we were bothering them, and as someone else mentioned, seemed as if they were bored. Maybe that’s a part of the charm, but there was zero hospitality at this place. With that said, I would go back since the food was good.

I have tried many items over the years from their nicely diverse menu and have never been disappointed.  Always delicious, well prepared food efficiently served by a friendly and attentive staff.  Especially love the spinach potato cakes and fried catfish with green tomato chutney.

I have spent years making a trip to Early Girl a requisite experience anytime I visit Asheville; in the past, the long wait for breakfast has always been well worth the scrumptious food. 
So the restaurant is now apparently under new management.
The Early Girl Benny is no longer on the menu, and both my entree, the spinach-potato cakes and my husband’s meal, the sweet potato-sausage scramble, were all mushy and just mediocre. 
The biscuits and jam were good, and at least we got there early enough to not have to wait. 
I’m also sad to hear that King Daddy’s is no more.
We may come back, but I doubt that we’ll be making an effort for this place on future trips.

Came by on a slow Monday morning. I always liked the space when the former restaurant was there.
Staff was friendly and certainly tried to accommodate me after I received my meal.
I thought the price was a little high for breakfast and expected something delicious and a big portion.
I ordered the Vegetable bowl with scrambled eggs.
First a very strange combination of food, sweet potatoes seasoned with cinnamon and tomato salsa? 
Rice and beans on a bed of raw spinach. It was all cold with warm eggs on top a little shredded cheddar cheese on top of that with salsa and avocado to finish this mischmash of food. And its was dry. No moisture whatsoever. 
I had heard such great things but this was disappointing. Menu was not for me.

The food was good with a varied menu. I just found it too pricey for what you got. For example a side of macaroni and cheese is $5 or fried chicken and 2 sides is about $20.
The service was good and you are given biscuits with nice jam or honey.

Great restaurant. Recommend reservations as they were very busy. Service was good and food was excellent. My favorite was the hanger steak. Cooked exactly as ordered and had a great char. Glad we tried out this place.

Tupelo Honey has some of the beast breakfast in the area. I had the pecan pie french toast, and the pecan filling was delicious. The atmosphere is welcoming and the open kitchen adds a great touch - I recommend sitting up at the bar if you can. The staff were very friendly. They also make a killer mimosa!

We came for Brunch on a Sunday and it was crowded but was not uncomfortable.  The layout is done so that you aren't too close to the next table.  We ordered shrimp and grits and Shakshuka. The food was delicious and served in large portions. It came out in a reasonable amount of time and the service was excellent. Great spot for Brunch!

Our dinner at was delicious and the service was friendly and prompt. We definitely recommend making a reservation as it is usually busy during dinner. Quaint downtown restaurant. Fried okra was delicious. Biscuits were bland. Service was very good. Fried chicken was plentiful. Mac and cheese was some of the best I have ever had. Grits were good. A little pricey. Great little spot in the downtown bustle of Asheville! Very busy but waitress was fantastic. Make a reservation thought, walk ups had to wait a long time for a table!

Great book selection, events and community involvement. 100% behind worker-owner collective. Only suggestion is be a bit kinder and helpful to those who might not look as “alternative” as others. Check your ageism too. Despite a couple of awkward experiences, I’ll continue to purchase and support Firestorm whenever I am on the west side of town and recommend to friends.

Brilliant bookstore that has amazing selection that I have not found in other local bookstores. I love supporting a business that ensures there is a safe space for all. I love their kids book selection with great picture books that help families tough topics. Also, their bathroom sign made me giggle.
Unique bookstore. Very informative and modern material. This place hosts events. Great location in west Asheville.

Much to my chagrin, they no longer serve espresso drinks (I really miss the Molotov Macchiato), but they still have really good serve-yourself drip coffee. Where Firestorm truly shines is their selection of subversive literature and the different programs and meetings regularly held there. One of the few shining examples of a collective endeavor in our state.

Firestorm is a perfect stop for readers of all kinds. They stock a wide selection of literature, comics, zines, and so forth, most of them aimed at progressive and inclusive writers and topics. The whole place is well-curated and fascinating -- a great destination for readers in the area.

Great vegetarian and vegan dishes, drink selection, and value. $4.50 for the draft beers is quite reasonable. The sauce for the vegan wings was really tasty, as was the house made ranch dressing. I wish there was a place like this in the city where I live.
P.S. Happy to support a place that provides nutritious meals to low income people.

I love Rosetta’s. The food is amazing, and the people there are great. I can’t say enough good things. Go there. If you want free parking put Cherry St. into your GPS. Park at the skate park. It’s a short walk up Lexington. You’re welcome.

This place would definitely get 4 stars if it wasn't for the service. I have been very disappointed multiple times due to the attitude of the staff. Many times I have felt like a burden for ordering food. The staff just seems like they don't want to deal with people. Another issue is the state of the kitchen. Consistently look dirty and unorganized. On a good note, the food is great. I still recommend this place to many people because of the food and the charitable gestures the restaurant has to the community.

WoW!! Absolutely wonderful spot, food was fantastic to put it modestly, ...... that vegan Ruben tho 👀💥🔥 amazing!! Outstanding casual atmosphere so many great things to say, you should just check it. Out for yourself 👍

What a lovely spot with tasty food that was prepared well and speedily for us, which was great.  We had a limited lunchtime before needing to return to a workshop. I highly enjoyed my organic salad with portobello and my friend loved her coconut curry bowl, which looked delicious.
I love the owners.  Richard and his wife offer their restaurant as your home.  The Blue Ridge is the best of all sandwiches...Unless you ask my husband who will always choose Philly Cheese.

The staff have always been really nice, and the pizza delicious. 3 bucks a slice is worrisome until you realize it's 1/6 of a pie vs. 1/8. But the owner.... man! He is extremely rude and curt to his employees, and he doesn't go out of his way to be kind to his customers if you know what I mean. I haven't been there without having to hear him talk down to someone. I try to avoid him in both locations, he's usually downtown during the day and uptown in the eves.... but it's not always a guarantee. 

That and the unfortunate fact that there aren't slices ready to rip... expect to wait there for 10 or 15 minutes if you want a slice. That ain't NY style Jimbo!! 

(I prefer Favilla's... despite its deplorable location, their pizza is just about as delicious, it's cheaper, you can walk in and get your slice in a minute, they have the classic two slice special, a variety of daily specials, and the staff is always kind.)

Love this place. Best pizza (outside of Blue Mountain Pizza in Weaverville) in Asheville. However, the owner is SUPER RUDE!

Also, be aware that they've changed drink companies (from Coke to Pepsi) and how they hand out drink cups. It used to be that they would give you a to-go cup no matter what you ordered. Now they have plastic cups and - despite paying 2 bucks for a drink - won't give you a to-go cup if you ask... instead, they'll be incredibly rude and demeaning.
This pizza is the bomb... and everybody who works there is a down to earth individual. Get yourself a slice,the price is right!

Absolutly disgusted at what myself and my wife witnessed tonite at our favorite pizza place which we wont ever go back to .the owner first went outside to pet a large dog then came back in and without washing his hands keep on with his evening.then the pizza maker and the female went outside to have there smoke break and pet the same dof. Both returned to work and the fellow went right behind the counter and started to make a pizza both not washing there hands .i was so disgusted we left. I got home and called spoke to owner he avoided me by saying he dont handle food. Thats poor ownership.then he handed the phone to his underling which basically blew me off.so i called the othet owner at other store and explained to him what happened and how the situation was just blown off .and he flat out told me he didnt believe me .to which i responded you may speak to my wife. He said i dont think my employees did that i said we watched it as we were eating .and we have been loyal customers since you opened your doors .why would i lie... I will be reporting this to the health dept on tuesday. Their concern about cleanliness upset me more then anything.i realise we are only one family but i hope others understand how disgusting that truly is

I've loved Marco's... Er, 828 Family for well over a decade. It has been my go-to spot for quality pizza and excellent service. Whenever I have friends from out of town, I bring them here and it never fails to impress. A small, lively atmosphere, delicious menu options, and great local taps - they will always have a warm place in my heart.
(Pictured is a customized white pizza with pesto, roasted red peppers, spinach, and goat cheese 😍)

Me and my husband were instant fans of this place! When we went it was extremely busy but we were able to get seated right away and our server was so friendly. We got a pizza with bacon and pepperoni and they are very generous with their toppings. The seasoning on the pizza was amazing. The other thing I loved about this place is it was surprisingly affordable. The medium size was perfect for me and my husband to share.

Cozy environment but with ample room with plenty of seating. Great selection of local brews. LARGE portions at very reasonable prices. Fresh, hot and delicious food that is served with a smile and very attentive table service. It's no wonder they've been so highly rated and existed for over 25 years!
I love this pizza joint! Recently stopped in to order a pizza, and always enjoy the pizza and the service. If you want real pizza and great service, you need to stop by 828(formerly Marcos).
828 Pizzeria had the absolute best stromboli I've ever eaten. I'm sure their pizza and pasta dishes are equally delicious. We will be returning there soon!

We had a late arrival and were exhausted when we sat down. However we rallied when we had our first bites. The pork chops were tender and cooked perfectly. Salad was simple and delicious. Excellent an reasonable wine. Cozy ambiance and quiet. What a gem of a place in Asheville! Their food is amazing. Even though it doesn't look like much on the outside, it's actually a nice place for a romantic dinner.

We had an excellent dinner experience. The vibe was dark and laid back, which I loved. The music was cool and not annoying, which is also really important to me if I'm gonna sit somewhere and hang out for a while. The servers were kind and helpful, and the food was excellent and so unpretentious. We also dug the tiny open kitchen. Would love to eat here again!

Aw man! This place is fun! The food is really good. Best done with some good friends so you can share plates and try a variety of things.  The only downside is it seems to be kind of off the beaten track.

Great experience! Started with one of the best pate's I've had in a while and the Moscow mule. Again, one of the better mules I've had. This place is all around solid. We had the pork shank which fell off the bone and was paired with some delicious pink eyed peas, even though I have no idea what makes them different from black eyed peas. 

The staff was helpful and friendly also, so it was a highlight of our trip!

The spaghetti was delicious! An absolute must try, my husband and I loved it and was completely surprised by the flavor. We also had the stake tartar, the egg was cooked to perfection but the beef was heavy handed in onion, but still delicious.

There was live music while we waited. The weight was 45 minutes but the food was amazing. The service was quick there was little flowers in our drinks. The sausage was divine the hot cakes were fluffy and moist. The fruit was fresh. The French toast was perfect. Not too sweet. And not too saturated with egg. It had fluff in it still. They even served the dog on the patio. They gave him a water bowl. Not our dog but I thought that was wonderful. they sell cookbooks and hot sauce and little hats and little shirts and this place is a very good hotspot to go.

Wow! Amazing food and extra wonderful service. Our waiter was so informative, fun and energetic. The restaurant was busy even on a Wednesday morning. Parking lot was packed so we had to walk. All the ingredients in all the dishes were fresh and flavorful. This is the breakfast burrito which was delicious and had quick the kick with chorizo. Our group ended up buying hot sauce, mugs and goodies to go! It was a delicious breakfast!

Very quality food, but had an extremely long wait for the food after we ordered. Very expensive if your vegan because they have to add on (wish it could be for substitution oriented). $17 for a breakfast burrito and a coffee. 😬 But all in all, still very delicious. Also, EXTREMELY friendly staff. Loved the vibe in there.

Always delicious food! The oatmeal banana pancakes are super delicious and, most importantly for me, egg free. It's great to be able to order something for breakfast instead of oatmeal or sides since I'm allergic to eggs. 

Hubby absolutely LOVES the shrimp and grits. He says its one of the best he's ever had anywhere. I'm not a fan of shrimp but the sauce is delicious and the grits are nice and creamy. 

Weekday mornings are much less crowded and hectic than weekends.

Breakfast in Asheville is obviously popular and Sunny Point Cafe is a star on this foodie stage for good reason. The staff was very friendly and courteous which made the hour long wait bearable. I had their Shrimp and Grits which was easily one of the best I’ve had. Everyone in our party thoroughly enjoyed their meals. Highly recommended!

HANDS DOWN wonderful! The ribs are amazing and the sides... the smashed sweet potatoes, jalapeno grits,  corn pudding,  and collards are just as good.  If you perfect the mac-n-cheese, I will give you a 5 star 12 Bones! Impressive indeed!

Delicious barbecue. Love the art district. Easy to park, murals everywhere, great service. The ribs are so so good. If you're allergic to dairy you will only be eating meat and coleslaw, but it was the best coleslaw I've ever had. Good mix of sauces to try too. Feel free to write on the walls and let people know you were also there.

One of the best barbecue joints I've ever been to. Went there with friends and we all got different items to get a full idea of the menu. Everything was great, was very surprised at how good the chicken was. Nice variety of sauces available. Love the graffiti around the place and the sharpie notes inside. Would highly reccomend anyone in the area to check out.

The food was amazing, especially the ribs. The sides were good the collard greens, baked beans and cold slaw. Loved the mac&cheese, but the potato salad needs lots of work and the fountain drinks. The root beer was awesome all the others tasted funny. But over all a great place to eat really glad we stopped there to eat.

The employees (especially the nice lady that takes your order) are all very nice. The wedge salad is the BEST EVER! The chopped brisket is Fabulous! We love 12 Bones and plan to eat here on our frequent trips to Asheville. The ribs are wonderful and the mashed sweet potatoes are the best...not too sweet...perfect! They no longer offer straws, though. I prefer a straw.  I guess I could bring my own. 😉

Absolutely wonderful!! Love the new (within last year) menu. Ryan was our server and he was as great or greater than the food. My wife and I were celebrating her birthday and were made to feel "special". We will be back!

The interior decor is lovely. The wait staff was excellent. The Montepulciano..expensive!  Unfortunately our meals were not good. Some lamb strips stuffed into a pita with mixed greens. Not exactly a gyro.

We had a delightful experience here. The food was superb, the ambience perfect, but above all else we enjoyed our service from our waiter Ryan D. His welcoming personality and clever wit made this a memorable evening and we will be sure to return! Thanks, Ryan!

The food was delicious - minus the hair in my husband’s moussaka. But the service was SO SLOW. Everything took forever. And we were met with attitude from more than one employee when presented with simple requests. I noted the hostess actually rolling her eyes at one of my friends. Avoid this restaurant, unless you want your meal served with hair & a side of attitude.

This is a quaint little spot in downtown Asheville.  The food is absolutely wonderful with generous portions.  Food is made to order and always fresh.  Pricing for two adults with wine, salad,  shared entree, dessert, and coffee is $100.  $6 fee for sharing a dish (chef divides in the kitchen).  Otherwise, you can share plate at the table.

Great service and environment, went there on Thursday which is apparently jazz night. They had an awesome live jazz band playing that night. Wide variety of drinks to choose from with two bars, one upstairs and one downstairs. Four pool tables upstairs to keep you busy, 10 cent for every minute you play which is not bad at all. Highly recommend visiting.

Good food and great beer. Amazing pizza and garlic knots. Laid back atmosphere. Tables and laid back dining room setting on main floor. Upstairs has bar and billards. Friendly and helpful servers. My only complain was with the hostess. Myself and two others in my party we're the first to arrive out of our party of 8. The hostess refused to seat us until more of our party arrived. I didn't understand her reasoning as the three of us awkwardly stood by the front door as she continued to seat other people. Besides that I had a great experience
Great selection of beer and the food was amazing. The bartenders were very friendly and efficient. Overall great place

Came in to play some pool and enjoy some beers. Ended up trying some of the food. The garlic knots where huge and getting them topped with Mozzarella was fantastic! They had peanut butter cheesecake that was great. Definitely a great hangout!

First time visit, pleasantly surprised. It has an atmosphere of what Ashville was in the good old days. Quaint old bar with very good food, big TV for sports. Pizza looked good but we opted for the Jerk chicken sandwich and a burger. Both very good. Friend I was with had not been there in years..but remembered the jerk chicken and he was not disappointed. Excellent service. Set up to accommodate groups, youth friendly but has beer and sports for dad.

A great resort experience on Sunset Mountain. The view from the resort is phenomenal and best at sunset. The amenities are fantastic and the restaurants are top notch. Unfortunately, the rooms do not live up to the fit and finish of the common areas of the hotel. They are quite outdated and a bit uncomfortable for the high price. When you stay at this property, you are paying for the common areas, not the rooms.

This hotel is wonderful and unique. In a word it's magical. The staff are helpful and friendly and views inside and outside are amazing. It's stepping back in time the best way possible. You truly feel like you're on vacation at this resort. They make every attempt to create a peaceful environment.

Fantastic hotel. The spa is top notch. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Stayed in a Club floor room and would recommend this to anyone (daily breakfast, nightly happy hour, and spa access included), well worth the extra $$. Had dinner at Vue 1913. It is expensive but amazing, well worth the occasional splurge. Loved every minute being here.

Amazing resort with some great views of the mountains and downtown Asheville in the distance. There are a number of shops to visit, tasty restaurants to eat at and great outdoor seating! There are a number of bars and even an amazing spa! The staff is very friendly and helping. The rooms are nice and the beds are comfortable. I look forward to coming back again!

Absolutely stunning view from this porch. We just be for some drinks and the view and it was worth the trip. I wish we could have stayed until sunset but it was a hot day and we had more to see! I have to say the bartenders were especially excellent- I asked for something virgin and delicious and they did not disappoint!! I had a few of the peach, ginger mojitos! The peach drink on the menu was our groups favorite so if I come back I'll definitely be trying that.
